Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors

Class ActiveDataConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractDataConnector
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.ActiveDataConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectorI, DataConnectorI, ComponentInterface, DataOfferedCI.PushCI, DataRequiredCI.PullCI, RequiredCI
    public abstract class ActiveDataConnector
extends AbstractDataConnector
    The class ActiveDataConnector partially implements an active connector that can be used to connect active components in a synchronised way, on a mix of active and passive components using a full or partial pull mode. TODO: needs rethinking and redesign so to be used only when the two components use different push/pull mode so to connect them transparently.

    Description

    As there are two possible mode for transmitting data, push and pull, the connector establishes a two way connection between the two components, implementing the offering PushCI interface with methods calling the requiring PushCI and implementing the requiring PullCI interface with methods calling the offering PullCI one. A fully active connector has two threads: one to actively push data to the requiring component by calling its receive method, and one to actively pull data from the offering component by calling its get method. The connector acts as a bounded buffer between the two components. If the requiring component actively pull data from the connector, then the connector can be configured as a passive pusher, while if the offering component actively pushes data to the connector, then it can be configured as a passive puller. When the connector is configured as a passive pusher, then its implementation of the request method can be used by the requiring component to obtain new datum by accessing directly and synchronisely the buffer. In the same way, when the connector is configured as a passive puller, then its implementation of the send method can be used by the offering component to push new datum by putting them into the buffer in a synchronized way.

    Invariant

     invariant      isActivePuller => dataPuller != null
                                isActivePusher => dataPusher != null
                                                                                // TODO: to be completed...

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ActiveDataConnector()  
      ActiveDataConnector​(int bufferingCapacity)
      creates a new connector with some data buffer capacity, and with the default behavior of being both an active puller and pusher with minimum intervals between each push and each pull of 100 milliseconds.
      ActiveDataConnector​(int bufferingCapacity, boolean isActivePuller, int pullInterval, boolean isActivePusher, int pushInterval)
      creates a new active connector and fully configure it.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        bufferingCapacity - capacity of the data buffer.
        isActivePuller - true if the connector must be an active puller.
        pullInterval - minimum interval between pulls in milliseconds.
        isActivePusher - true if the connector must e an active pusher.
        pushInterval - minimum interval between pushes in milliseconds.
